intro: Valeriana plectritoides var. pallida, commonly known as the pale valerian, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It is valued for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
